name: InboxFacet
description: InboxFacet. This is the facet that holds all the functionality needed for Connext's messaging layer to reconcile cross-chain transfers. Authenticated (proven) message data is delivered to the `reconcile` function, where it is parsed to determine the message action. Tokens are credited (representational assets are minted, canonical tokens are unlocked from escrow) if applicable.

eventDecorators.name: Receive
eventDecorators.description: emitted when tokens are dispensed to an account on this domain emitted both when fast liquidity is provided, and when the transfer ultimately settles.

parameterDecorators.name: originAndNonce
parameterDecorators.description: Domain where the transfer originated and the unique identifier for the message from origin to destination, combined in a single field ((origin << 32) & nonce).

parameterDecorators.name: token
parameterDecorators.description: The address of the local token contract being received.

parameterDecorators.name: recipient
parameterDecorators.description: The address receiving the tokens; the original recipient of the transfer.

parameterDecorators.name: amount
parameterDecorators.description: The amount of tokens being received.

eventDecorators.name: Reconciled
eventDecorators.description: Emitted when `reconciled` is called by the bridge on the destination domain.

parameterDecorators.name: transferId
parameterDecorators.description: - The unique identifier of the transfer.

parameterDecorators.name: originDomain
parameterDecorators.description: - The originating domain of the transfer.

parameterDecorators.name: local
parameterDecorators.description: - The local asset that was provided by the bridge.

parameterDecorators.name: routers
parameterDecorators.description: - The routers that were reimbursed the bridged token, if fast liquidity was provided for the given transfer.

parameterDecorators.name: amount
parameterDecorators.description: - The amount that was provided by the bridge.

parameterDecorators.name: caller
parameterDecorators.description: - The account that called the function.

parameterDecorators.name: _nonce
parameterDecorators.description: The unique identifier for the message from origin to destination.
